oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate Wiley Bartlette at Vicksburg
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. Bartlette was from Claiborne Co. and served in Co. H, 61st TN Mtd. Inf. He is writing to his wife Sallie from Vicksburg: "I can see the Yankeys gunboats and transports." The besieged Confederate defenders of Vicksburg were being slowly squeezed; by the Union encirclement, and Bartlette speaks often of the worsening food, commenting on the high price of flour and the "bad smell of the pork meat."
